author: Liza Lin
title: Burner Phones, Bug Sweeps: How Companies Cope with IP Theft in China
text:
The Trump administration’s move to impose at least $30 billion in new trade tariffs on China—which could happen as early next week—comes amid continuing complaints by U.S. businesses that their trade secrets aren’t safe in China.
The corporate playbook in China has long required a few extra pages on defense for companies with intellectual property at risk. To protect confidential discussions, companies sweep conference rooms and hotel suites for hidden listening devices, people familiar with corporate security say.
